channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dumped Mattress, 6th October
item.description:
This mattress has been left here for several days and has already been reported multiple times. You’ve stated that the matter is under investigation—but no investigation is needed. It simply needs to be removed. Over the weekend, during high winds, it became a traffic hazard. It is also undoubtedly a fire risk. Please arrange for its removal as soon as possible

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dowlas Street, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: URGENT; dustbin lorry has caused telephone pole to come down and cause a 2ft hole in the pavenment and damaged the pavement too, 6th October
item.description:
URGENT; dustbin truck has caused telephone pole to come down and cause a 2ft hole in the pavenment and damaged the pavement too - resident was behind truck and it mounted the kerb and took down pole and has broken the pavement and it is going to cause serious injuries if not sorted out. Truck just drove off and left it. Please can this be looked into asap.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Frognal Avenue, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wayside Grove, Elmstead, London

item.title: Excessive litter, 6th October
item.description:
Hi - we have a continual issue with litter at the top of Fleetwood Street and in front of the fire station. As a street, the residents go out with litter pickets trying to keep it at bay but sometimes, like last night - it’s just overwhelming.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Church Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gum on the pedestrian wait button, 6th October
item.description:
Not sure how long this has been on the light for, but it is absolutely disgusting for someone to stick (what I'm assuming is chewing gum) all over the button. Please can this be cleaned - it's so unsafe for people who come into contact with it, especially young children that are eager to press the button.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, East Street, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Scaffolding lorry on double yellow lines and dropped kerb blocking garsge, 6th October
item.description:
We have one scaffolding lorry (ERA Scaffokding) in the residents parking bay which HAS correctly applied to park there. This Boxhill scaffolding lorry has nothing to do with ERA, has no dispensation to park in the residents parking bay and is on double yellow lines blocking a residents garage. This is typical of workmen at York House.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Knox Street, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fallen Trees, 6th October
item.description:

item.title: Play area gate does not close, 6th October
item.description:
The main yellow gate at the play area in Queens Gardens has been broken for some time. The gate is supposed to swing shut and stay closed; however, the spring must be broken as the gate is often left open by people being unaware of this issue. Please can this be fixed to ensure the safety of children using the play area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kentish Way, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet
